org.ftcbootstrap

Class ActiveOpMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • LinearOpMode
      • org.ftcbootstrap.ActiveOpMode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DemoBotAdvancedOpMode, DemoBotOpMode1, DemoBotTeleOpMode, EncoderMotorOpMode, EncoderMotorTest, EncoderTankDriveOpMode, EncoderTestFromGamepadButtons, EncoderTestFromGamepadSticks, NavBotManual, NavBotTelemetry, NavigateWithEncoders, OpMode1RunForTime, OpMode2RunForTime, OpMode3RunForTime, OpMode4RunUntilTouch, OpMode5StateMachine, OpMode6DriveWithGamepad, OpMode7ServoWithGamepad, PushBotAuto, PushBotAutoSensors, PushBotManual, PushBotManual2, PushBotOdsDetectEvent, PushBotOdsFollowEvent, PushBotTouchEvent, TelemetryTest

    public abstract class ActiveOpMode
extends LinearOpMode
    OpMode Abstract class that offers specialized telemetry and error handling to ensure that a LinearOpMode runs smoothly in its "active" hardware state

        protected void onStart()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        override to this method to perform one time operations after start is pressed
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • activeLoop

        protected abstract void activeLoop()
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Implement this method to define the code to run when the Start button is pressed on the Driver station. This method will be called on each hardware cycle just as the loop() method is called for event based Opmodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • sendTelemetryData

        public void sendTelemetryData(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Send telemetry to the Driver Station App
        Parameters:
        key -
        message - Note. TelemetryUtil.addData(String, String) only puts the data in a queue for later ordering.

        To send the data on to the Driver Station use: TelemetryUtil.sendTelemetry()
